constraints_details.constraints_layer_description: KTCAAP Name: Kingston Town Centre AAP
KEYACH Name: Kingston Town Centre Key Area of Change
CONARA Name: Kingston Old Town Conservation Area
KEYACO Name: Kingston Old Town Conservation Area
AIRCZ Type:: Gatwick Airport Wind Turbine Consultation Zone:Contact: The Safeguarding Department, Gatwick Airport Limited, 7th Floor Destinations Place, London Gatwick Airport, West Sussex, RH06 0NP

AIRCZ Type:: Heathrow Planning Consultation Zone: All buildings, structures, erections and works exceeding 90 metres in height (295.3 feet)Contact: The Safeguarding Department, Heathrow Airport Limited, c/o Planning Services, First Point, Buckingham Gate, Gatwick Airport, West Sussex, RH6 0NT

description: Installation of illuminated sign to the rear of the commercial unit
decision_conditions: Staff employed in the preparation, maintenance & completion of official poll cards

Where an advertisement is required under these Regulations to be removed, the site shall be left in a condition that does not endanger the public or impair visual amenity.Reason: To comply with Regulation 14 of the Town and Country Planning (Control of Advertisements) (England) regulations, 2007 in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Any structure or hoarding erected or used principally for the purpose of displaying advertisements shall be maintained in a condition that does not endanger the public.Reason: To comply with Regulation 14 of the Town and Country Planning (Control of Advertisements) (England) regulations, 2007 in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Any advertisement displayed, and any site used for the display of advertisements, shall be maintained in a condition that does not impair the visual amenity.Reason: To comply with Regulation 14 of the Town and Country Planning (Control of Advertisements) (England) regulations, 2007 in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Officers consider that there would not be an impact, detrimental or otherwise, in terms of public safety and in particular any negative impact on highway safety. Officers consider that there would not be any detrimental impact on amenity.

The sign permitted by this consent shall only be illuminated during the opening hours of the premises to which it relates.Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining residential occupiers in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

The intensity of the illumination of the lighting permitted by this consent shall be no greater than 50 cd/m. Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining residential occupiers in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.
The proposed ramp does not constitute development.

The proposed alterations fall within the parameters of permitted development as set out under Schedule 2, Part 1, Class A of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).

The proposed extension and alterations fall within the parameters of permitted development as set out under Schedule 2, Part 1, Class A of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).
We cannot accept "approved" plans you have provided making this application invalid.Please provide only existing and proposed plans and elevations.
Please also provided applicant contact details

Please be advised that a fee of £1250 is required for this application as the creation of a flat (to include conversion) is shown on our Pre-App fees regulations. The additional £950 can be paid either online at www.kingston.gov.uk or by calling our Customer Service Team on 020 8547 5002Kindly also note we are unable to consider 2 schemes in one application made, as in this case you are showing 2 proposals. If you wish for both to be considered then 2 fees, of £1250 each, will need to be made. Otherwise submit one scheme, to be considered, and any changes made to it can be considered as a follow up
B1 - Means of Warning and Escape
